reference.title: libmexample: Using the Standard C Math Library
reference.shortdesc: This example demonstrates the use of math functions, such as gamma(double), that are part of the Standard C Maths support library (libm.dll).

section.title: Purpose
section.p: This example application shows how to use the libm.dll library. It:

li.p: reads an input value supplied by the user
applies the gamma function on the input value

section.title: Download
section.p: Click on the following link to download the example: libmexample.zip
Click: browse to view the example code.

section.title: Class summary
section.p: The example shows the use of the following API:

li.p: gamma(double) from the Standard C Maths support library (libm.dll).
You can build the example from your IDE or the command line.
If you use an IDE, import the bld.inf file of the example into your IDE, and use the build command of the IDE.

If you use the command line, open a command prompt, and set the current directory to the source code directory of the example. You can then build the example with the SBSv1 build tools with the following commands:
How to use bldmake and How to use abld describe how to use the SBSv1 build tools.
For the emulator, the example builds an executable called libmexample.exe in the epoc32\release\winscw\<udeb or urel>\ folder.

section.title: Running the example
section.p: Run the libmexample.exe executable. The example application waits for the user to enter an input value.
